champ.champInfo:
Chief judge of the competition:
Serhiy Yuriyovych Bronistovsky, 6th dan, Branch Chief of the National Kyokushinkai Karate Federation of Ukraine

Competitions (individual and team) are held in the section "KUMITE" according to the Olympic system, according to the Kyokushinkai rules karate approved by the Ministry of Family Affairs of Ukraine, of youth and sports in 2004 Competitions are judged in accordance with the standards and the rules of the International Organization (5 judges, ensign alarms). In the absence of an athlete on the mat after the announcement his surname within 1 minute of the athlete is counted defeat.
Teams of all versions and Kyokushin karate federations of the cities of Kyiv region, the city of Kyiv and other regions of Ukraine that received individual official invitation from competition organizers, and accept these rules competitions
At this tournament, appeals are not accepted. Video recordings matches are not reviewed. Exclusion: by the chief judge only contested episodes of Vasari, Ipon, ganten, sikaku. Interruption can occur only with consent representatives of both teams.

The competition is held on December 16, 2023

VENUE: NATIONAL UNIVERSITY OF PHYSICAL EDUCATION AND SPORTS OF UKRAINE (NUFVSU), Kyiv, str. Physical culture, 1, building 5

Competition program on December 15, 2023.

  • 17:00-19:00 - mandate and medical commission, weighing, registration of participants, judges and team representatives

Competition program for December 16, 2023.

  • 07.00-08.30 – registration; mandate committee, weighing participants
  • 08.30–08.45 - judges meeting
  • 09:00–09.15 - ceremonial opening of the competition
  • 09.30–13.00 - qualifying matches
  • 13:00-13:30 - break, lunch of judges and staff
  • 13.30–17.00 - semi-final and final matches
  • 17.00-18.00 - awarding of winners and prize-winners

Categories Series "A" (boys, girls) 0-9 kyu:

  • 2017-2018: -20.0 20.0+
  • 2015-2106: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 +40.0
  • 2013-2014: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 +50.0
  • 2011-2012: -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 +55.0

Categories Series "B" (boys, girls) 8kyu and older:

  • 2015-2106: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 +40.0
  • 2013-2014: -25.0 -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 +50.0
  • 2011-2012: -30.0 -35.0 -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 +55.0

Categories of kumite without division into series of young men:

  • 2009-2010: -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 -65.0 +65.0
  • 2007-2008: -55.0 -60.0 -65.0 -65.0 -70.0 +70.0
  • 2005-2006: -60.0 -65.0 -70.0 -75.0 -80.0 +80.0

Categories of kumite without division into a series of girls:

  • 2009-2010: -40.0 -45.0 -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 +60.0
  • 2007-2008: -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 +60.0
  • 2005-2006: -50.0 -55.0 -60.0 +60.0

In case of insufficient number of competition participants, availability of different levels and qualifications of athletes in a weight category or other reasons, for the purpose of high-quality and safe conduct of the competition, the organizers of the competition have the right to make the following changes:

  • combine some weight and age categories
  • to hold competitions in the appropriate weight categories according to the round robin system

All kicking techniques of kyokushinkai karate are allowed in all age groups

Match time

  • 2009-2018: 1.0 min. + 1.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 2.0 kg)
  • 2007-2008: 1.5 min. + 1.0 min. + weighing + 1.0 min. (The difference in weight is 3.0 kg)
  • 2005-2006: 2.0 min. + 2.0 min. + weighing + 2.0 min. (The difference in weight is 3.0 kg)

Rewarding

The winners and prize-winners of the competitions are awarded with cups, medals and diplomas of the respective degrees. The teams that will take 1, 2 and 3 places will be awarded with a monetary reward:

  • 1st place: UAH 3,000
  • 2nd place: UAH 2,000
  • 3rd place: UAH 1,000

The amount of the voluntary contribution for participation in the competitionx is UAH 800.
